text: Bundala National Park is a protected national park in the southeast of Sri Lanka. The area of 6216 hectares was first protected in 1969. It is an important wetland and was added to the list of Ramsar sites in 1990. There are many animal species living in the park including elephants and turtles. Because of the wetlands there are many species of bird which come to the park, including flamingos, pelicans, and storks. ==References== Category:1960s establishments in Ceylon Category:1969 establishments in Asia Category:Biosphere reserves Category:Geography of Sri Lanka Category:National parks in Asia Category:Ramsar sites Category:Wetlands
title: Bundala National Park
